intro: Craterogyne djettii, commonly known as the Canary Islands nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple. It produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisine. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
